value.0: Hello there. Come to get your supplies from ol' Olgerd, have you? Good idea. Can't have you wandering about the streets naked. Might give the academy a bad name.
Welcome back, <FirstName>. So what can old Olgerd do for you? You want to take a peek inside my shop, or is there something else?
I'll do my best to answer your questions, though I don't know much. I haven't left the city core since the plague hit.

This ain't no natural plague, mark my words! The instructors back at the Academy don't like to talk about it, but I think somebody or something brought the Wailing Death upon us for some fell purpose.
Huh? It's rare anyone asks about me. Not much to tell, really. As a young man I came to the Academy so I could join the Neverwinter militia and serve my city.
I served nearly a hundred and forty years, until my hair grew gray, my eyes grew dim and my back bent with age. But I had no family, no wife or kids, and I didn't want to retire.

So they were kind enough to give me this job here at the Academy, helping out you new recruits by giving you quality equipment at a reasonable price. So that's it, my life in a nutshell. Anything else I can do for you?
Well, ever since the plague hit, the academy is in dire need of funding. Dire enough that they bought a merchant stall for me to sell their excess equipment and other adventuring gear.
Of course, academy students like yourself get a discount. Was there anything else you wanted to ask of me?
I'm afraid that's beyond me. You'll want to go to the Cloaktower in the Beggar's Nest for that. I'd take the ferry if I were you, it's quite a walk.

Yes, <lad/lass>, as a matter of fact I do. I heard that you're allowed to go through the gates of Neverwinter now. That's good. The Wailing Death has drained most of our resources, and I'm afraid that we're about to run out of the necessities here.
Seeing as you are given free reign to leave, I'm going to give you a few letters that you can take to our neighboring allies to see if they can send some supplies our way.
Oh. Okay. Anything else I can help you with today?

Excellent. One thing we are in dire need of is food. Port Llast has a good supply of crops and fish that we can use to feed the people of Neverwinter. You'll find that town if you exit the northern gate, and head due north.

We also have need of medicines and herbs. I have heard rumours that healer in Thundertree is quite the forager and may have some to spare. You can reach Thundertree by heading east from Neverwinter, then south until you see Neverwinter River. The village lies just east of the river.

Finally, we need lumber to rebuild the damaged parts of the city, particularly the Beggar's Nest. It's far, but the mountainous town of Highcliff should have plenty, thanks to their skilled woodcutters. You can get there by going south of Neverwinter, down the southern High Road.
I wish you luck.
Ah, that is very good to hear. Rioters and looters may have ravaged our fair city, but we can always rebuild it. Here is some gold, for your effort.
Ah, that is very good to hear. I have hope that these herbs and medicines will do much good in easing the pain and suffering affliciting our citizens. Here is some gold, for your effort.
Ah, that is very good to hear. Our people are so very hungry, and I am sure it will be put to good use. Here is some gold, for your effort.

I know the journey you have taken to deliver to these outlying towns and villages must have been a long one. Here, I'd like you to have this magic bag of holding. May it make your travels in the future a little bit easier.
Farewell.
I want to ask you some questions.
What can you tell me about the plague?
Tell me about yourself, Olgerd.
How come I don't see you at the academy anymore?
Can you identify my items?
I was wondering if you had any work for me.
Sorry, but I'm not an errand boy.
I can do this.
I will set off on my journey, then.
I have news from Highcliff. They will send some lumber.
I have news from Thundertree. They will send some medicine.
I have news from Port Llast. They will send a shipment of food.
I'd like to see what you have for sale.
